sentences.en: An override of the veto appears unlikely.
sentences.cn: 看来推翻这项否决的可能性很小。

sentences.en: For months there was a veto on employing new staff.
sentences.cn: 有好几个月禁止雇用新职员。

sentences.en: I positively put a veto upon your doing so.
I would refuse to let you even veto.
sentences.cn: 哪怕是你只行使否决权,我也不同意.

sentences.en: Jenny wanted to invite all her friends, but I quickly vetoed that idea.
sentences.cn: 珍妮想邀请她所有的朋友，不过我立即对此表示反对。

sentences.en: Mother put a veto on our stayingout late.
sentences.cn: 母亲不允许我们在外面呆到很晚才回来.

sentences.en: My political belief, my ideals, compel me to veto this bill.
sentences.cn: 我的政治信仰 、 我的理想迫使我否决这个议案.

sentences.en: Should the president veto the appropriations bill, it goes back to Congress.
sentences.cn: 假如总统否决了这项拨款提案, 就把它退还给国会.

sentences.en: The governor's veto kept the bill from becoming a law.
sentences.cn: 州长的否决使该法案无法成为法律.

sentences.en: The President has the power of veto.
The president has the power to veto bills.
The President threatened to use his veto over the bill.
sentences.cn: 总统威胁要对这个议案行使否决权.

sentences.en: The president vetoed the bill, and the Senate failed by a single vote to override his veto.
sentences.cn: 总统否决了该议案，而参议院以一票之差未能推翻他的否决。

sentences.en: The Senate had a sufficient majority to override the presidential veto (= not accept his refusal ).
sentences.cn: 参议院有足够的多数票可以推翻总统的否决。

sentences.en: The veto has been a traditional instrument of diplomacy for centuries.
sentences.cn: 几个世纪以来否决权一直是外交上惯用的手段。

sentences.en: The veto was a calculated political risk.
sentences.cn: 这项否决是一次精心策划的政治冒险。

sentences.en: The White House says the president would veto the bill.
sentences.cn: 白宫称总统将否决这项议案。

sentences.en: Wilson vetoed this measure, and his veto held.
sentences.cn: 威尔逊否决了这一法案, 而且他的否决有效.

trans.tran_cn: 否决权，否认权，行使否决权，否决理由
trans.tran_en: a refusal to give official permission for something, or the right to refuse to give such permission
if someone in authority vetoes something, they refuse to allow it to happen, especially something that other people or organizations have agreed
if someone in authority vetoes something, they refuse to allow it to happen, especially something that other people or organizations have agreed

trans.tran_cn: 否决，不同意，不批准，禁止
trans.tran_en: if someone in authority vetoes something, they refuse to allow it to happen, especially something that other people or organizations have agreed
